title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Thursday 19 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: council defends cycle track against claims of 'huge ' overspend .
bouncing quad bike alerts rescue team .
mp calls for cash for kendal bypass .
cumbrians struggle with new benefit system .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 've now finished keeping up with cumbria 's news , travel , and weather forecasts , and a few other things , for the day .
here 's a reminder :
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow to do it all again .

in the meantime , if you 've a photo you 'd like to share with the county , or news you think we should know , you can email us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: evie 's dad greg wins 'inspiration ' award
text: a west cumbrian father whose baby died at just 6 months old has been given a national award for his work to help others .
greg johnston , from cockermouth , was given an inspirational father award at this year 's national butterfly awards .
his daughter evie was born with a hole in her heart and underwent many operations during her short life .
along with his wife gill , greg founded the charity team evie in her memory .

documents.title: egremont bridge is reopened after checks
text: cumbria highways engineers say egremont bridge has reopened after checks .
the bridge was closed after high river levels last week , and it 's been blamed as partly reponsible for long delays on the a595 during rush hours

documents.title: bouncing quad bike alerts rescue team
text: volunteers from the cave rescue organisation on a call-out to rescue a schoolgirl who 'd fallen ill near ingleborough found themselves diverted to a second rescue when a quad bike rolled down a hillside .

phil james said the driver was very lucky : `` he was higher up the hillside , and many people might have thought it was just a broken down quad by the track , if we had n't seen it come down the hill . ''

documents.title: your red sky in the morning
text: with the weather forecast for the next few days , the proverb about red skies in the morning may just be right .
our thanks go to steve hillman who tweeted this in our direction
if you 've a photo you 'd like to share with the county , you can email us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .

documents.title: travel : crash closes two lanes on m6
text: a crash has closed two lanes southbound on the m6 between junctions 37 for sedbergh , and 36 , and congestion is building up .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : wet , to be blunt
text: further outbreaks of rain are likely overnight , becoming a little lighter and patchier through the early hours .
it 'll be a mild night , with temperatures of around 10c ( 50f ) around towns .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: zipwire plan firm insists : it wo n't spoil the view
text: the company planning to provide zipwire thrill rides across a cumbrian lake has released this to show the impact on views across the valley .
the company says the visualisation , prepared by a local landscape architect ian ibbotson , suggests the wires across thirlmere would be barely visible from more than a few hundred yards away .
( if you look for two dots between trees on the right-hand side , they simulate riders on the wire . )
mike turner , the managing director , says the company 's now finalising a planning application to the lake district national park authority .
the park 's planners , until now , have approved zipwire rides in forest locations but not where they cross long distances in open country .

documents.title: hammer attacker 'chased victim through kendal '
text: a 27-year-old man is in hospital after being chased from kirkbarrow into kirkland in kendal by a man who then attacked with a hammer .
police say a number of people are thought to have seen the attack at about 14:00 yesterday afternoon , and they 're appealing for witnesses .
a 20-year-old man has been arrested on sus of causing grievous bodily harm and affray .

documents.title: on the march in medieval style in kendal
text: the weather forecast for the weekend is not brilliant , but if you fancy living as norman soldiers and their camp-followers did in the 12th century , the opportunity is there
historia normannis kendal is recruiting new members !
join us in fletcher park on sunday @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: cyclists say new track could be big city attraction
text: a cycle track at the middle of a political row in carlisle should be completed and put into use , says the city 's main club for the sport .
the circuit in harraby is being questioned by conservative opposition councillors because the cost has shot up and the opening has been delayed by several months .
but keith bickley from the border city wheelers will prove a big draw .
this would be a big attraction , not just for local cyclists , but for carlisle itself . ''

documents.title: top trainers saddle up to follow in red rum 's tracks
text: racing trainers nigel twiston-davies , donald mccain , jonjo o'neill , lucinda russell , nicky richards and michael scudamore all have numerous entries in today 's red rum day , carlisle 's opening jump meeting of the season .
the aintree legend red rum prepared for each of his three grand national triumphs in the 1970s by winning the windermere handicap chase at the city track .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: college books in towie star for prize-giving
text: dressed like this , joey essex could walk past most members of the older generation without getting a second glance .
but for anyone who follows the only way is essex , having a tv star as guest of honour at ullswater community college is the biggest news in penrith .

documents.title: council defends cycle track against 'overspending ' claims
text: the labour leader of carlisle city council is defending the amount of money being spent on a cycle racing track in the city .
the facility would be the only one of its kind in the county .
it 's known it will be over budget by more than £ 100,000 , but the deputy leader of the opposition conservative group , gareth ellis , says the true amount is larger .
speaking on bbc radio cumbria this morning , colin glover said councillors had been told the full amount , but that could n't be made public because it was part of a commercial contract .
the money has come from a reserve that is set aside for leisure purposes , so it 's not as though we 're stealing the money from another service . ''
you can hear the debate on breakfast with mike zeller here .

documents.title: new cycle track £ 109,000 over budget
text: new cycle track £ 109,000 over budget

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cloudier , with rain later
text: cloud will build throughout the day , with rain spreading from the south .
the winds will be from the south east and temperatures will reach 14c ( 57f ) .
you can see the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: mp asks government for bypass cash for kendal
text: westmorland and lonsdale lib dem mp tim farron has asked the transport secretary to find money for a northern bypass for kendal .
a new report from cumbria county council says a road around the northern side of the town could reduce congestion , especially when traffic is diverted off the m6 because of accidents .
transport secretary chris grayling said he 'd set up a fund for such projects and he 'd be prepared to meet mr farron for further discussions .

documents.title: county warned of high winds at weekend
text: the met office has warned of winds gusting to 70mph around cumbria 's coasts on saturday .
the yellow warning , the lowest level of alert , covers the whole 24 hours .
forecasters say it will coincide with high spring tides , leading to locally dangerous conditions

documents.title: carlisle appeal miller diving charge
text: carlisle appeal miller diving charge

documents.title: cumbrian a & e unit 'at breaking point '
text: some staff at carlisle 's hospital have told bbc radio cumbria that its accident and emergency department has been at breaking point this week .
it comes a day after figures were released showing hospitals across the county and the country are failing to meet government targets over patient waiting times .
sources at the cumberland infirmary say a & e reached its worst point for 30 years on monday .
dr rod harpin , executive medical director at the north cumbria nhs trust , says it 's been a very difficult time :
it was four tough days .
on monday we had to focus on moving our patients through into safer places than the emergency department . ''
but he added there are ways to avoid situations like this :
putting in place improvements where our patients get care closer to home , to prevent them coming into hospital , and then can be discharged earlier with support in the communities . ''

documents.title: county backs call for new kendal bypass
text: kendal needs a northern bypass to deal with its growing traffic , according to a new county council report .

the study has concluded that a northern access route would be the best way to take the pressure off the town centre roads , especially when closures on the m6 mean thousands of vehicles are diverted .

there 's been a debate in the town for many years about whether the road would help or not , but this report , the first to back the project so firmly , suggests the council might add the route to its plans .
julian rayner from @ twitterid tells me a line on a map 's needed next , for possible relief road on n side of kendal @ twitterid
building roads generates traffic rather than relieving it .
new name is kendal northern development rd !

documents.title: new benefit delays hit cumbrian families too .
text: some cumbrian families are among those going hungry and are at risk of losing the roof over their heads , after being moved from the old benefits system onto universal credit , which is paid four weeks in arrears .
the chief officer at allerdale citizens advice , martin telford , says the problems are caused by delays to the new payments , which can stretch to six weeks or longer .
yesterday in the house of commons the government announced helplines would be free to call , but resisted pressure to pause the introduction of the new service while problems were ironed out .
allerdale and copeland were among the first areas in the country to move onto the new welfare system about a year ago .
author: Sian Hall
BBC Radio Cumbria

documents.title: school asks for 1.5m buttons for holocaust project
text: school children in windermere are collecting hundreds of thousands of buttons as part of a holocaust memorial project .
the youngsters study at the lake school , which stands on the site of huts used to house children rescued from concentration camps in 1945 .
the school now wants to build a memorial and students were asked what small items could be used to bring home the enormity of the atrocity .
one teenager suggested buttons , and so far , 3,000 have been collected towards a target of 1.5m .

documents.title: sellafield firefighters strike again
text: sellafield firefighters strike again

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : improving
text: temperatures at 3,000ft : 9c .
winds : strong southerlies , gusts 40mph .
cloud : widespread cloud down to 1,000ft ( 300m ) at first , becoming more scattered around 2,600ft ( 800m ) by lunchtime .
visibility : moderate or poor at first , improving mostly good later .

documents.title: sellafield fire crews strike for second day
text: firefighters at the sellafield nuclear site are taking industrial action for the second time in a week today .
members of the gmb union are on strike for 12 hours from 06:00 in a dispute over pay .

documents.title: true cost of cycle track being hidden , tory councillor claims
text: the amount of money being spent on a cycle racing track in carlisle is `` huge '' but is being kept secret , according to an opposition city councillor .
gareth ellis is the deputy leader of the council 's conservative group .
he says although an overspend of £ 109,000 is in the public domain , the true figure is much higher .
not only is it £ 69,000 , and then £ 40,000 , but then there 's this huge amount of money and we 're not allowed to tell you what it is . ''

the circuit , the only one in the county and mainly paid for by british cycling 's governing body , was due to open in september but the track failed load-bearing tests and it will not now open until the end of november .
the council says extra costs have been incurred , but they are necessary to bring the track up to an acceptable standard .
author: Bob Cooper
Political reporter, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: travel : long delays on main west cumbria commuter road
text: there are delays of an hour or more on the a595 between whitehaven and calder bridge due to the closure of egremont bridge and industrial action at sellafield .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : a bright start before cloud rolls in
text: it 'll be a largely dry and bright start to the day across cumbria with a few sunny spells , and any mist and fog clearing .
but cloud will build throughout the day , with rain spreading from the south later .
temperatures could reach about 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: good morning .
we 'll be bringing you the news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and other things that catch our eye from around the county through until about 18:00 .
if you 've a photo you 'd like to share with the county , or news you think we should know , you can email us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter
